Package sample

Class PlayField

  • java.lang.Object
    • sample.PlayField
  • public class PlayField
extends java.lang.Object
    The class which will encapsulate the play field of our game.

    • Method Detail

      • getPlayerCardsList

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<GameCard>> getPlayerCardsList()
        getPlayerCardsList will return list of Every players cards from the perspective of the local user who will be limited in what he/she sees by the information he has.
        Returns:
        A List of List of game cards which represent each players hands.

      • getPlayerSeatNumber

        public int getPlayerSeatNumber()

      • getInfoTokens

        public int getInfoTokens()
        getInfoTokens will return the number of info tokens in the playField.
        Returns:
        An integer which is the number of info tokens in the playfield.

      • getFuseTokens

        public int getFuseTokens()
        getInfoTokens will return the number of info tokens in the playField.
        Returns:
        An integer which is the number of info tokens in the playfield.

      • discard

        public void discard​(DiscardResponse discardResponse)
        Given a discard response we will either decrement the info tokens and update the view if the discard was accepted by the server. Otherwise nothing is done. Notifying the obsevers in the end.
        Parameters:
        discardResponse - A discard response object formed form a Json message recieved form the server

      • otherDiscard

        public void otherDiscard​(int pos,
                         GameCard card)
        Other discard will be called if our client receives a notice message from the server. If that is the case we update the discarding players hand with the newly drawn card and increment our info tokens. notifying the view in the end.
        Parameters:
        pos - The position in the hand of the card discarded
        card - The card which was drawn from the deck.

      • play

        public void play​(PlayResponse playResponse)

      • otherPlay

        public void otherPlay​(int pos,
                      GameCard card)
        In the event of someone else playing a card will call otherPlay. given the position of the card played and the updated card. We will update the playFile with the played card, update the playing players hand with a new card.
        Parameters:
        pos - The position of the card which was played by the playing player.
        card - The card which was drawn by the server and given to the playing player

      • addObervor

        public void addObervor​(Obervor obervor)
        adding an observer to the playField model which will be used to provide a view to the user of the playField.
        Parameters:
        obervor - the observer who will be observing the model.

      • giveHint

        public void giveHint​(HintResponse hintResponse)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Changes the fields of playfield for an outgoing hint action The only thing that changes is an info token is used up
        Parameters:
        hintResponse - hintResponse - A hintResponse intance created from a message received from the server in response to our hint.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there are no information tokens remaining

      • receiveHint

        public void receiveHint​(GameCard info,
                        boolean[] positions)
        Receives a hint from another player Updates the players hand if there are still hint tokens available
        Parameters:
        info - The suit or rank hinted at, given as a string
        positions - An array of booleans containing true if the card in that position satisfies the hint condition and false otherwise
